Penfold

According to the stats, there are currently seven members online, but only four names show on the list, incuding my own. Why do registered members lurk on their own board? Is there a valid reason for skulking anonymously? Do they de-cloak to post? Just an idle thought.
peteratwar
Basically I drop in daily to see if anything that interests me has been posted. If so I log in otherwise I see no need
jim's trucking

According to the stats, there are currently seven members online, but only four names show on the list, incuding my own. Why do registered members lurk on their own board? Is there a valid reason for skulking anonymously? Do they de-cloak to post? Just an idle thought.
Yes. Any reason they may have for not showing on the active list is valid. 
 
 I don't know that I'd call it skulking. I consider that a sinister term, implying deliberate mischief. Some people just want to be anonymous or incognito...nothing wrong with that. I know people that have lurked here for years before registering.
thelmoose

How does the system know a member is online without signing in? and wouldn't that reveal the name?
 
 I see what you are talking about. How does one sign in and not have one's name revealed?
isly ilwott

How does the system know a member is online without signing in? and wouldn't that reveal the name?
 
 I see what you are talking about. How does one sign in and not have one's name revealed?
I believe you can elect to be incognito in your User CP.
 
 I read here for about two years before registering. Sometimes I read without signing in. It's not that I don't want people to know I'm online...I just wait 'til I find something worth commenting on to sign in.

I believe you can elect to be incognito in your User CP.
 
 I read here for about two years before registering. Sometimes I read without signing in. It's not that I don't want people to know I'm online...I just wait 'til I find something worth commenting on to sign in.

 
 I see. Didn't know that option was available. So it sounds like you have to sign in and select that option to be listed as a nameless "member".
 
 The two computers I use store cookies so I am automatically signed in. The password they give you is "strong" and I would never remember it.
Archangel

I see. Didn't know that option was available. So it sounds like you have to sign in and select that option to be listed as a nameless "member".
 
 The two computers I use store cookies so I am automatically signed in. The password they give you is "strong" and I would never remember it.

 
 It's not an incognito or nameless feature, but is an invisible feature. That's why it will say that 7 members are on line, but only show, let's say 5 names. In that case 2 members are in invisible mode.
thelmoose

It's not an incognito or nameless feature, but is an invisible feature. That's why it will say that 7 members are on line, but only show, let's say 5 names. In that case 2 members are in invisible mode.

 
 Not that this matters so much, but if, in the invisible mode, and one's name does not show, how does that differ from being incognito or nameless?
Archangel

Not that this matters so much, but if, in the invisible mode, and one's name does not show, how does that differ from being incognito or nameless?

 
 It's called "invisible mode" moose. not nameless or incognito mode, that's the difference. If someone goes looking for the nameless or incognito mode they will come up empty handed. But viola, if they look for invisible mode they will hit the jackpot. That's the reason that it matters.
